item.title: Function for locating an email address
item.description: Yesterday I was given a relatively easy task: find out who or what has a given email address. As this was within our own Exchange organization it proved to be quite simple: You can achieve the goal with a simple one-liner: get-recipient -ResultSize unlimited | where {$_.emailaddresses -match "email@address.com"} But wouldn’t it be easier to have it in a function? In Powershell, creating functions isn’t all that hard. Basically all you need to do is wrap the command or script block with a function statement, see here:
